title: When Do Discourse Markers Affect Computational Sentence Understanding?. (arXiv:2309.00368v1 [cs.CL])
abstract: The capabilities and use cases of automatic natural language processing (NLP) have grown significantly over the last few years. While much work has been devoted to understanding how humans deal with discourse connectives, this phenomenon is understudied in computational systems. Therefore, it is important to put NLP models under the microscope and examine whether they can adequately comprehend, process, and reason within the complexity of natural language. In this chapter, we introduce the main mechanisms behind automatic sentence processing systems step by step and then focus on evaluating discourse connective processing. We assess nine popular systems in their ability to understand English discourse connectives and analyze how context and language understanding tasks affect their connective comprehension. The results show that NLP systems do not process all discourse connectives equally well and that the computational processing complexity of different connective kinds is not always

translated_title: 论论文时候会影响计算句子理解
translated_abstract: 在过去几年中，自然语言处理（NLP）的能力和使用情况显著增长。尽管已经有很多研究致力于理解人类如何处理话语连接词，但对计算系统中的这一现象的研究还不够。因此，很重要的是将NLP模型置于显微镜下，检查它们是否能够充分理解、处理和推理自然语言的复杂性。在本章中，我们逐步介绍了自动句子处理系统的主要机制，然后着重评估了话语连接词的处理。我们评估了九个流行的系统在理解英语话语连接词方面的能力，并分析了上下文和语言理解任务如何影响它们的连接词理解。结果表明，NLP系统不能同样好地处理所有的话语连接词，并且不同连接词种类的计算处理复杂性并不总是相同。
tldr: 本文研究了自然语言处理（NLP）系统对话语连接词的理解能力，发现不同的连接词种类的处理复杂性不同，对上下文和语言理解任务有影响。
en_tdlr: This paper investigates the understanding ability of natural language processing (NLP) systems towards discourse connectives, finding that different kinds of connectives have varying levels of processing complexity and are influenced by context and language understanding tasks.
